Arsenal want to make 22-year-old winger their first January signing – report

Arsenal will make a fresh attempt to sign Thomas Lemar from Monaco in the January transfer window, according to reports in the British media.

The Daily Mail is reporting that the Gunners will return with a new bid to try and land the 22-year-old France international after having been heavily linked with him over the summer.

Arsenal “have agreed” to pay €37m (£32.7m), and €3m (£2.6m) in bonuses for Sevilla midfielder Steven N’Zonzi, according to El Gol Digital.

Rumour monger El Gol have been notoriously inaccurate with their reports on transfers, and it is wise to take this one with a huge pinch of salt, but the Spanish publication believe that a €40m (£35.3m) deal could be finalised when the January transfer window opens.

ARSENAL'S OZIL PUSH?

Arsenal are making a last push to keep Mesut Ozil, according to the Daily Mirror.

The paper says Arsene Wenger is still hoping a new round of negotiations will persuade the 29-year-old to stay at the club.

Manchester United and Barcelona are both said to be interested in Ozil, who is free to sign a pre-contract with foreign clubs from January 1.
